buildings 800 rooms we used internal labor to discover the devices and

an email to our customers we had a wallpaper on the TV and we said you know
let's see what happens we knew that we wanted to have data and understand how

we're calling the chime meeting bridge we added the ax tag to all of those calls and that way we could look at our
call data records from our vc systems and know how many times a chime meeting
had been joined using alexa and we did a similar thing with our in room systems
we added a qk tag to those calls and that allowed us to build a dashboard where he could easily track adoption
week over week so a few weeks after we
had launched the pilot we started reaching out to our customers to understand their experience we sent out
surveys and we scheduled open houses in their building the the feedback that we
got from from these was easily fit into three groups we had a group that was
using it regularly loved it they were very vocal about that we had another group who hadn't noticed the devices in
the room and our change management really hadn't reached them and the third
group they noticed the devices but they were withholding from using it because they had some concerns they didn't know
if it was approved if there was privacy concerns or InfoSec concerns so they
were they were not using it yet but we saw that even a few weeks after launch we had already reached 34 percent
adoption so a 34 percent of our time meetings were being joined by saying Alexis start the meeting and this was a
lot higher faster than we were expecting and so it really clued me in that this
was something our customer our customers were liking so we from
those open houses in the customer feedback we identified kind of the top likes the top dislikes the top likes
were the faster meeting start times customers liked the convenience of not
needing to manually enter the chime meeting ID and being able to find out
who actually has the room booked was great and kind of settled those hallway disputes the dislikes were as you can
imagine at Amazon there's a lot of meetings where Alexa is the subject of the meeting and gets brought up quite a lot and so sometimes Alexa would go off
when you weren't intending to so that was a dislike and then a lot of our
devices were getting unplugged and so people who wanted to use Alexa than had to go plug it back in so that was a
those are the top two dislikes and coming out of that we identified three challenges that we wanted to go after
there was a timeout issue that was happening with exchange and so sometimes
when a customer would say Alexa start the meeting we weren't able to get the
chime meeting ID from exchange in time to connect them and they had to manually enter their pin so we wanted to figure
out what was happening there and see if we could improve that addition we want to understand what is the motivation
behind people unplugging devices why is that happening and lastly we came across
kind of a booking protocol issue in that some people would reserved a room using
a blank invite and then they would create another invite with all their invitees and their content and their
agenda and that would have the chime meeting ID and so because of that booking protocol issue you know Alexa
for business wouldn't see the chime meeting information so we wanted to see if we could address that through
education with our customers but customer anecdotes are focused for
us and reading through the customer feedback that we received we received
many really strongly worded customer anecdotes that showed us how passionate people were and how much they liked this
new experience so to continue to drive
adoption and try to work on those challenges we increased our we've improved our change management so we we
use different channels than we had used originally we wrote a better email we
